data.title: Cup n Saucer
data.text:
I've been going here on and off for more than 40 years. It's a fairly new owner named Plouffe now. It was a great change in looks.
I took my wife for lunch as she has never been here. What a great menu. I got the bacon burger and she ordered a similar burger (I forgot the name). The waitress explained the ingredients and answered any questions. She had a great personality and even sang the tunes on the juke box (in a good way). The experience was great. The burgers were exceptional, buns toasted, ingredients good etc. I would go back. A very eclectic ambiance of old school diner.

data.title: Great gem!
data.text: Came in on Tuesday around 930. Awesome little diner. You can tell everyone is like family and I felt right at home. The service was great, the food was delicious, with generous portions at a great price. I will definitely be back!

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: The breakfast here is awsome .Its got that old school 50s classic vibe with juke boxes on the wall.The menu is perfect and the food and service is really great.Not all breakfast spots are created equal but you definatley cant go wrong with this one.

data.title: Like the old days
data.text: The last meal we had there was excellent,it was Sunday BBQ, we had food to share (to much) not just plenty, but great tasting,served hot, no limit. Bobs always around to make sure things run smoothly We'll be back. Also have been for Breakfast.

data.title: Great Lunch
data.text: We had Lunch with Friends.  Two of us had Breakfast and two of us had Lunch. It was all very good and the Help was Friendly and Helpful.  Try the "wieners" with a meat sauce.

data.title: from breakfast to lunch but do not miss out on Sundays BBQ
data.text:
rI can not believe what I am going to tell you about today as I did not think it was possible. However phere goes. Sundays only from 1pm to 7pm no time limit. As much as you can eat,Home made and BBQ on a great special grill outside the restaurant and served inside by the staff.
remember everything htere is fresh,home made and outstanding in quality. Ready?? Giant platters of BBQ meats brought to you by the staff.so no standing in lines.the platter had..real prime rib,bbq chicken, ham,pulled pork, fall off the bone ribs,all served with a giant bottle of home made bbq sauce.so good. then home made baked beans,coluerd greens w/bacon.home made cole slaw,fantastic mac.& cheese again home made and outstanding.home baked,muffens and also corn bread.  all for $15.00. get outa here. I can not get a large pizza for that amount.  So on a Sunday go here to Cup and Saucer. Oh yes,free parking either on the street or just across from C &S there is a large free parking garage so just cross the street and you are there. do not miss this outstanding deal,I had my fill,watched some football and then get this, The meat and corn bread that was left over was packed up for us to take home.the food is outstanding,the service was great,the deal was unreal.try it. you will like me be going back. One of the best deals I have ever come across. this is the REAL DEAL........

data.title: bob plouffe always does it right. remember plouffe's meat pies? he is the man.
data.text: with such a great owner and such a great staff you will always be a winner.from the staff in the front to the chefs in the back he has it all covered. great diner style meals all from scratch and seating at the counter to booths. the decor is like out of a museum on the walls and the food is truly good. The best burgers anywhere and the meals are awsome and large and not expensive. Parking on the street or in the back of the restaurant. Has a full menu and also has an ice cream counter made of stainless steel.the real thing. Bob is a great guy and knows how to run a good restaurant. He may be funny but he is all business when it comes to his restaurnt business. he wants his customers to come back and he does it by giving great food and outstanding service.and he keeps his prices down ...all things cusomers love.

data.title: A good reason to visit downtown Pawtucket
data.text: This was the place that taught me about "wieners" and I am glad to know how good a "wiener" can be!!!  The simple hot dog was covered in tasty sauce to make it a darn good wiener. The service was fast and fun. Lots of cute, nostalgic deco on the walls.  Menu has a good variety of choices to keep me coming back.

data.title: Great omelette upbeat place
data.text: We were looking for a quick bite late on a Sunday morning and found  Plouffe's Cup and Saucer. They have a juke box and a diner menu. I had a Mediterranean Omelette that was packed with fresh spinach and tomatoes and cooked to perfection. The Western was a great meal as well. The coffee was excellent and the service was great.

data.title: Don't miss the root beer float!
data.text: I was in there singing at the top of my voice to the juke box, I was not alone.  They make their own root beer. We went back twice.

data.title: A really nice small place to eat in Pawtucket on Main St. very good food.
data.text: I love the good homemade style of the food here. Mr.  Plauffe's meat pies at one time were sold in many stores in Rhode Island. They were the best. I think the restaurant may have some from time to time on sale.They have a great back wall of articles that should be in a museum and are a great way to show history. Again a small place but the food is good and they make outstanding burgers;

data.title: banana foster french pork pie are to die for
data.text: if you like good experience this is the place. The staff is very friendly and offers great food.  lots of off street parking.  its worth the trip.

data.title: Great nostalgic diner
data.text: I love plouffes! My husband and I eat here a lot. The decor is nostalgic and The food is fresh and cooked to order. I highly recommend the meditarianian omelette. They have no problem substituting cooked veg or fruit for the more starchy sides. They serve Bliss Bros Ice cream sundaes too.

data.title: Good food, Pretty good Service!
data.text: I've been several times and the food is always good, if you are willing to wait. I've had many breakfasts there and a few lunches. Th menu is full of good choices and is well prepared every time. The only thing lacking is consistent service. Some of the wait staff become preoccupied with chatting about their personal lives that the forget you are there. Many times I've had to get up from my table to get a refill of coffee. You have to interrupt their conversation to get their attention. I think the Manager is aware of the problem but is helpless to control members of the owners family. Sadly this takes away from an otherwise excellent. So it's worth a roll of the dice to have good food in a cool 50's diner atmosphere, with a 50/50 chance you might get attentive service. I go back so I think it's worth the chance.

data.title: yes
data.text: Great place to hang. Plenty of seating, off-street parking, bottomless delicious coffee. The breakfasts are delicious. Free WiFi. Be sure to get a pork pie to go!

data.title: great smoked BBQ!
data.text: enjoyed a bbq pork sandwich with a side of Cole slaw. The meat is smoked on the premises and the owner also has a street vendor truck. The sandwich was fresh and the sauce had good flavor but didn't overpower the smoked flavor. Good service. I will be back!

data.title: Nice "mom and pop" breakfast and lunch spot -- also pizza
data.text: I've had both breakfast and lunch at Plouffe's Cup N Saucer located in the nearly deserted downtown area of Pawtucket, RI.  I go there not as a "destination" place to eat, but to have some well prepared food while I'm waiting to have my car serviced at the nearby Apex Tire and Auto Service, just a short walk from the restaurant.  The decor emulates a '50s diner, decorated with lots of auto memorabilia; fun to look at while waiting for your food.  The staff (I always eat at the counter) is cheerful, quick and efficient.  I once had one of their amazing muffins -- blueberry -- heated on the grill and served with butter.  Absolutely delicious, with good coffee to go with it.  The last time I was there it was lunchtime, and I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich which was not only hot off the griddle or sandwich toaster, but loaded with cheese and served with pickle slices, the way I like such a sandwich.  And almost the best part -- the prices are surprisingly low for this day and age.  I've never tried the pizza, but I saw other folks in some of the booths eating it quite happily, so I assume it must be pretty good -- at least.

data.title: Great if you like diners
data.text: We love going to diners and seek them out wherever we go. So we were very happy when a local told us to go there for breakfast. Great old time diner feel with retro signs and decorations. The breakfast food was really good and the service outstanding. It was a great little find!
